Posts.Content: I don't think anyone knows all the answers, some are genetic. But the main cause is longeivity, when most women died in childbirth there was very little cancer of any kind. It is mainly a disease of older women, although there are many exceptions.
Posts.Title: Why is there so much breast cancer??

Posts.Content: Sounds like they will want to at least do an ultrasound for further checking, maybe a biopsy. Please don't panic!
Posts.Title: mammogram results- need to be concerned?

Posts.Content: I didn't have them, but a friend of mine does. She is an 80+ woman and has to have mammograms about every 3 months to make sure they don't turn into anything else. They are not harmful, but are associated with a high risk for cancer.
Posts.Title: Breast Calcifications - Please HELP!

Posts.Content: I had a similar problem, the mammogram showed a mass, but it couldn't be seen with an ultrasound. Also, it could not be felt manually.
Posts.Title: High Density Mass?

Posts.Content: Sorry no one answered you, it is not cancer, it just may make it trickier to find.
Posts.Title: nodular density

Posts.Content: 12 and 6 position refers to the area, imagine a clock drawn on your breast..12 is the top (nearest to your neck) and 6 is on the bottom, not all that mysteroius.
Posts.Title: Both Breasts enlarged some other symptoms

Posts.Content: When I go, they alway ask if you have implants, so I guess they have some special precautions for women who do. The pressure is really not that much worse than a firm squeeze, so I would imagine the implants are sturdier than that.
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Test and Implants

Posts.Content: Where I go for a screening, what they check before I leave is to make sure that the image is readable. Later they are checked and they send out results. Hopefully they will rule out anything serious.
Posts.Title: Recalled for Diagnostic Mammogram-help!

Posts.Content: Give your doc a call now, don't wait 3 weeks to "mention" it. When you are this young, you probably have dense breasts and an ultrasound would probably be ordered, that would be relatively painless. The mammogram is not that bad, uncomfortable certainly but not agonizingly painful. The biopsy is usually a needle biopsy done with a local anesthetic, as they expained to me..no worse that novacaine at the dentist. A moveable lump is usually a fibroadenoma,(a benign growth) especially in a younger woman, but there is a small chance that it could be something else, so get it checked.
Posts.Title: Huge lump found, very scared, please help
